p: All three condensed tannin extracts demonstrated various degrees, yet very close dose-dependent inhibition of both egg hatchability and larval development. According to IC 50 and IC 90 values, the condensed tannin inhibiting egg hatching and larval development most potently was. R. glutinosa followed in descending order of activity by S. guineensa and A. gumifera. The result of the present study suggests that condensed tannins might be used as an option for the control of Haemonchus contortus of sheep.
